div.h1: What’s happening at your schools and in the district

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

h2.a: Families that have lost income during pandemic can apply for immediate cash from city bureau

div.div: Español| Tiếng Việt| 中文| Русский| Soomaali

div.p: Families in Portland that have experienced a loss of income during the coronavirus crisis can apply for $250 in immediate assistance from the Portland Housing Bureau. The city bureau will distribute immediate cash to 2,000 families that meet program criteria to help pay for such urgent needs as groceries, rent, utilities and medical expenses.

h2.a: Updated ODE Guidance for Grades 9, 10 and 11

div.div: Español| Tiếng Việt| 中文| Русский| Soomaali

div.p: On April 15, the Oregon Department of Education updated its Distance Learning for All guidance with a new section: Supporting our Students in Grades 9, 10, and 11. The updated guidance includes information about credits and essential learning.

h2.a: Upcoming Schedule for Computer Distribution and Replacement

div.div: Español| Tiếng Việt| 中文| Русский| Soomaali

img.style: display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: calc(800px * .2); height: auto; max-height: calc(450px * .2);

div.p: As we settle into PPS-HD, our home-based distance learning program, we want to update you on our computer distribution, along with our computer repair and replacement plan. For families that still do not have an available computer at home for students to use, or need to exchange the one they recently received because of technical issues, we have these upcoming opportunities for you:

h2.a: Update on Student Assessments for the Remainder of the 2019-20 School Year

div.div: Español| Tiếng Việt| 中文| Русский| Soomaali

div.p: We would like to update you on the status of district and state tests for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. If you have questions about student testing, please contact Testing Help at testinghelp@pps.net.

h2.a: Information night will support families dealing with substance use and addiction

div.div: Español| Tiếng Việt| 中文| Русский| Soomaali

img.style: display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: calc(540px * .2); height: auto; max-height: calc(800px * .2);

div.p: Substance use and addiction are confusing and difficult issues for the person experiencing them and for those who love and care about the person who is impacted. To help Portland Public Schools families of students dealing with substance use, we will host our first district-wide Family Information Night.

h2.a: Snow Days: How we inform, when we inform, how we decide, plus makeup days

div.div: Español| Tiếng Việt| 中文| Русский| Soomaali

img.style: display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: calc(534px * .2); height: auto; max-height: calc(800px * .2);

div.p: The recent dip in temperature is raising the questions that come up every winter in Portland Public Schools. Folks want to know how we decide to delay or close schools, and how any missed classroom dates are handled. Here are answers to questions we often hear:

h2.a: Support and resources available for students dealing with substance use

div.div: Español| Tiếng Việt| 中文| Русский| Soomaali

img.style: display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: calc(540px * .2); height: auto; max-height: calc(800px * .2);

div.p: Portland Public Schools offers a variety of supports and opportunities for students and their families to increase their understanding of adolescent substance use and healthy decision-making.

h2.a: Come learn about the Portland Dual Language Teacher Residency Program

div.p: Are you highly bilingual, a college graduate and would make a great teacher? The Portland Dual Language Teacher Residency Program is recruiting candidates to become dual language educators and leaders in Portland Public Schools. Please plan on attending an informational meeting on January 8, 2020, at 6:00 p.m. at the PPS main offices (501 N. Dixon St.) in the Columbia Conference Room (2nd floor). For more information, visit the Portland Dual Language Teacher Residency Program website or contact Alma Morales Galicia at amoralesgalicia@pps.net or 503-916-3546.

div.p:
The District is committed to equal opportunity and nondiscrimination in all its educational and employment activities. The District prohibits discrimination based on race; national or ethnic origin; color; sex; religion; age; sexual orientation; gender expression or identity; pregnancy; marital status; familial status; economic status or source of income; mental or physical disability or perceived disability; or military service.
ADA Accessibility/District 504 Contact: 503-916-5460
ADA Employment Queries Contact: 503-916-3544
Title VI Contact: 503-916-6499
Title IX Contact: 503-916-3340
